Name: Starcadia Quest: Needles
Description: Contains hero card and miniature for Needles.

Name: Starcadia Quest: Build-a-Robot – Companion Pack
Description:
This companion pack brings 3 full new Robot Companions, comprised of 3 Top Parts and 3 Bottom Parts. These offer even more options when playing with the Build-a-Robot expansion, since all Robot Parts are interchangeable!

Contains 3 robot miniatures and 6 robot part cards.

Name: Starcadia Quest: Build-a-Robot – Extras
Description:
This expansion contains 4 robots and 2 monsters.

Robots:

     Laser-Tilt
     Nano-Dash
     Xeno-Shift
     Meta-Click


Monsters:

     Y-Crush
     Omega Launcher

Name: Cearnage
Description:
Cearnage was a play-by-post combat game supporting multiple opponents in a single coliseum-style play area.  Players could enter the game at any time and continued in the game until their persona was killed or remained as the sole survivor.  A "turn" took place over about a one-month period - players submitted by post written turns using a semi-standard format (freeform actions and explanatory notes were allowed); the results were published in the next monthly issue of Lokasenna.

Player personas started from a base template and then were customized by spending points from a pool to gain benefits - increased characteristics, weapon or shield skills, combat skills, or armor.  Once a persona was created it was placed into the combat arena and beneficial changes thereafter were quite limited - harmful changes resulted from combat.

Written player orders consisted of a movement action and a combat action - a variety of each were available.  The game referee received all written orders and then determined outcomes.  Some outcomes were determined by game rules; other outcomes were adjudicated by the referee.

Cearnage rules were published in Lokasenna (Issue 9 - Nov 1983) and play turns appeared from that time forward.

—user summary

Name: Dreams of Typhon
Description:
"A Dungeon Crawl Card Game in Space"

Dreams of Typhon is a card game about exploration, cooperation, and a desperate fight for survival. Players take on the role of one of six Survivors that have been trapped on the behemoth space station Typhon as they frantically fight for their lives. Each time the game is played, the layout of Typhon Station changes. Players draw Room Cards to represent their journey through the station. Rooms have various events that could prove to be fatal and may contain a deadly monster known as an Anomaly. However, some rooms contain precious Gear that can be used to level up Survivors to increase their chance of survival.

--publisher's description

Name: Uber Soldat!: Payback! Expansion
Description:
In Uber Soldat, the allied forces have become outmanned and outgunned, hardpressed to accomplish their missions.

So Payback brings much-needed and highly-anticipated reinforcements for the allied forces.

With the Payback box set you will receive additional U.S. troops and equipment in addition to two extra character cards to add suitable miniatures as you see fit.

Add some more hard-hitting fire power to your U.S. forces!

—description from the publisher

Name: Mysthea: Volfyirion's threat
Description:
The Dragon miniature of Volfyirion can be used both as an expansion for Mysthea and Mysthea: The Fall.

In MYSTHEA:
Its Monster Card is revealed from the first Era, while the Dragon Miniature is placed in the center of the map: this will prevent the Islands from moving.

If the storm card is played, Volfyirion moves towards the Island it is currently facing and attacks it.

During the dragon’s attack, all players are called upon to defense. It is up to each player to stand up to their nemesis or call a retreat and abandon the opponents to their fate!

If Volfyirion is not defeated, it will destroy everything on the unfortunate Island.

Only players who show their courage by facing and defeating Volfyirion are able to retrieve one of the five Qoam crystals  placed at the base of the miniature. Crystals can be spent to boost the effects of the cards.

Champions located on the Island will be then cast out and Volfyirion will nest its lair in the Island. Until the end of the Era no type of unit is allowed to enter it.

At the beginning of the next Era the dragon will return to the middle of the five Islands, at the center of the game board, ready to attack again another island!


In MYSTHEA: THE FALL

Mysthea can be merged with Icaion to create Mysthea: The Fall, and Volfyirion has a crucial role in the final chapter of this saga

After The Fall, the balances of Icaion broke irreparably. Ancient forces unleashed from the crystals, wild energies that channeled through the Henakor and started to resonate everywhere. Summoned by these ancestral energies, Volfyirion flew to the Henakor blinded by this immense power.

The dreadful beast is making its growl heard in the depths of Icaion, calling every kind of creature toward the City and the crystal it surrounds.

Volfyirion miniature is placed in the center of the map and replaces the Colossus in this scenario.

Some rules will be different, and introduce a different challenge to the usual Mysthea: The Fall.

The final goal is to defeat the creatures that are destroying the City and obtain all Volfyirion's shards.

Name: Sea Change
Description:
Sea Change is a card-laying spatial puzzle for 2 players. It’s a bit like poker reimagined as a strategic, swingy, cutthroat match-3 game.

All you’ll need to play are a standard 52-card deck, some tokens (poker chips, meeples, etc.), and the goal board and 16 goal cards that can be printed and cut out.

In Sea Change, you compete to fulfill poker “hands” – straights, flushes, at the like - in particular geometric arrangements. Say, four cards of the same suit in an “L”. Harder hands will net you more points, but your opponent will also be angling to complete the same goals.

On top of that, each card value has a special power that alters the game rules in interesting ways!

Name: Mano-a-Mano: A Rowdy Time in the Old West
Description:
Mano-a-Mano is a fast, universal game system that can be used for skirmish or role playing games.

It is mainly concerned with movement, combat, morale, and other connected actions, with lots of detail on gambling, travelling, swag...it's all there.   
The rest is left to your imagination.   
So, you can rob the town bank, chase banditos as part of a posse, or fight off an Apache war party.

If you want to use these rules for skirmish combat only, the section at the end covers character types, eliminating the need to generate individual characters, and a high speed combat system.  
So, if you want to re-fight little big horn, you won't be bogged down with the Role Playing parts of the game.

 Materials needed to play are:

     two six sided,
     one twenty sided dice,
     figures for your characters,
     and any terrain you may want to use (either lead or paper figures will do just fine), 
     Rulers, 
     tape measures, 
     and pencils will come in handy.   


Once you have all that stuff t'gether, git you a few good fellers in one spot, and git to makin' fun.

—description from the publisher

Name: Beneath a Moonlit Sky: Nightfighter Air Combat Rules Supplement
Description:
A supplemental set of Night Fighter rules for WW2 air combat.

Beneath a Moonlit Sky is a supplemental system for use with hex based table top air combat games. To date, the game has been tested with Knight's Cross and Above the Clouds.  But it should work equally as well with Check Six, Hunters in the Sky, or any other hex based system.

The rules hereafter describe hidden movement and radar tracking using early Ground Control Intercept and Air Intercept radar systems.

With just enough uncertainty added to give the feel of fighting in the dark, hunters and intruders make their way through the night sky, tracking incoming bombers intent on hitting their targets.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fire and Maneuver: v4.1 – Infantry Skirmish Combat in World War 2
Description:
The Second World War saw many new innovations to combat: new weapons from jets to atomic bombs, new tactics and doctrine, and innovations which replaced many old traditions.  
But through it all, the infantryman remained the one indispensable item on the battlefield.  
Even with all the invention and innovation, without the individual doughboy, war still could not be won.

Fire and Maneuver is a 1 to 1 scale game recreating the ground combat of the War.  
No mass tank battles, no ship to ship combat on the high seas, no dog fights at 20,000 feet.  
Just men clawing their way through no-mans land to get to the enemy.

Each figure represents one soldier, one tank, one gun.  
The Scale is small, one inch = 2 yards.  
The combat is fierce, even hand to hand.  
Each tactical move turn lasts only six to thirty seconds, but those few seconds can mean the difference between life and death, victory or defeat.

The game scale works best with 20mm figures (1/72 scale), but will work equally well with 15mm or 28mm.  
Included are two sample scenarios to get you started, as well as charts and stats for most of the common weapons in use through out the later stages of the war.  
The average table size for play is 4x8 feet, about the size of a ping pong table.

Turn Sequence:

     Morale Phase
     Suppressive Fire Phase
     Move / Spot Phase
     Defensive Fire Phase
     Combat Phase


—description from the publisher

Name: Literaci Lubelszczyzny
Description:
Literaci Lubelszczyzny ("Writers of the Lublin region") is an educational game which aims at getting to know both classic and contemporary writers connected with the Lublin region. The goal of the players is to select proper authors and the historical periods for literary works presented on cards. Points are awarded for the correct choices. The winner is the person who scores the most points.

The game is not available for sale. It was distributed to city libraries.

Name: Fire and Maneuver: v4.1 – Into the Abyss: The Invasion of Poland, 1939 – Platoon Orders, Vehicles, and Scenarios
Description:
Into the Abyss is the first supplement to the Fire and Maneuver skirmish rule system.

Covering the 1939 invasion of Poland, it brings in new squads, weapons, and vehicles from the early days of World War 2.

This is not a stand alone, and a copy of Fire and Maneuver is needed to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sedan 1870
Description:
End of August 1870. Bazaine and the principal French army have shut themselves up in Metz for a week. The marshal had time to send a message indicating his desire to attempt an exit if a rescue army arrived. But since then, there has been no news. To break the encirclement, Mac Mahon, at the head of the army of Châlons, receives the formal order from the government to rush at Metz to liberate its brothers in arms. The army of Châlons, composed of disparate elements (troops from Africa stand alongside the mobile guards of the Seine), must remain grouped and must move quickly to avoid being taken at the flank by the German troops. The Germans, commanded by Moltke himself, still believe the French to be at Paris, covering the capital. But the city of light is not his objective for the moment. His goal: the destruction of the French regular armed forces in a decisive battle.

Through "Sedan 1870", the evolution of the "Marshals of the 2nd Empire" campaign series, will you be able, like Mac Mahon, to cross the Meuse in time and go to the rescue of Bazaine’s army ? Like Moltke, will you manage to catch the French off guard and definitively vanquish the only enemy regular army still in movement ?


     Complexity : 7/10
     Solo playability : 6/10
     One turn = 1 day
     One counter = 1 division (and 1 SP = 2000 men, 1000 cavaliers or 2 batteries)
     Scale : 10 km between 2 zones


—description from the publisher

This wargame can be linked with "La guerre de 1870" to play the full Campaign of the Imperial War since the beginning of the war until the final decisive battle of Sedan.
(https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/311190/la-guerre-de-1870-la-chute-de-napoleon-iii-juillet)
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Bouton de Guêtre - Gaiter Button (Vae Victis)

Name: Age of Valor: The Seven Weeks War 1866
Description:
Seven Weeks War 1866 (and the 3d Italian Risorgimento) is an independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion chapter or mini-module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rule changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Any changes unique to the Seven Weeks War and the 3rd Italian War of Independence, the subjects of this expansion set, are included for both the conflict overall, and the included battles of Trautenau, Problus, Kissingen and Custoza scenarios.

The AOV product line is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 36 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at https://tinyurl.com/AOV-1866-SWW-Reference-Portal.

-description from the designer.

Name: Motorsport
Description:
Motorsport is a deck building game for 1-4 players that captures the frenzy of automotive competition.

You will compete against your fellow drivers to build the most competitive car, as quickly as possible. The goal is to win Events, such as drag races, car shows, drift competitions, autocrosses, and circuit races. The first player to win enough Events to claim seven Trophy Points wins the game.

You play with a personal deck which you will add to and expand as the game progresses. Your deck starts pretty weak, but each card you add to it will make it stronger! You will build your deck the same way you would build a car: by deciding what your goal is and purchasing Mods that support that goal.

The gameplay in Motorsport revolves around four Upgrade Types: Speed, Style, Handling, and Traction. Vehicles have stats for each Type, Mods belong to and support specific Types, and the winner of Events is determined by Vehicle Upgrade Type stats. You can choose which of the four Types you want to focus on, depending on your play style!

—description from the designer

Name: Skully Bunnies
Description:
Skully Bunnies is a Strategic Battle Royale Playing Card Game.

Gameplay:

Skully Bunnies is a fast paced card game inspired by fusion. Fusion is a process where the player combines cards to create characters with unique abilities. Be the first to fuse all of your Skully Bunnies and show everyone whose house it is! Blast your opponents faces with attack spells or defend yourself with spell cancelling cards. The only questions you must ask yourself is . . .

“Who Will You Fuse?”

—description from the designer

Name: Blitzkrieg in the West 1940: 50 Wargame Scenarios – Volume I: German - French
Description:
50 historical wargaming scenarios for miniatures featuring battles between the French and German armies in Belgium and France in May-June 1940.

Each scenario is complete and includes the original 1940 map the battle was fought over, the actual troops involved and the missions they had. These are not vague approximations but researched historical simulations.

Optimised for wargaming rules that use one stand = one platoon but easily converted. 
Games range from small encounters to large set piece battles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blitzkrieg in the West 1940: 50 Wargame Scenarios – Volume II: German - British
Description:
50 historical wargaming scenarios for miniatures featuring battles between the British and German armies in Belgium and France in May-June 1940.

These are all original scenarios. Each scenario is complete and includes the original 1940 map the battle was fought over, the actual troops involved and the missions they had. These are not vague approximations but researched historical simulations.

Optimised for wargaming rules that use one stand = one platoon but easily converted. 
Games range from small encounters to large set piece battles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blitzkrieg in the West 1940: 50 Wargame Scenarios – Volume III: German - Dutch
Description:
50 historical wargaming scenarios for miniatures featuring battles between the Dutch and German armies in The Netherlands in May 1940.

These are all original scenarios. Each scenario is complete and includes the original 1940 map the battle was fought over, the actual troops involved and the missions they had. These are not vague approximations but researched historical simulations. The campaign in The Netherlands lasted only five days but featured a very wide variety of tactical actions including parachute operations, assault river crossings, and commando raids. These are all faithfully captured in this volume.

Optimised for wargaming rules that use one stand = one platoon but easily converted. 
Games range from small encounters to large set piece battles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blitzkrieg in the West 1940: 42 Wargame Scenarios – Volume IV: Belgian - German
Description:
42 historical wargaming scenarios for miniatures featuring battles between the Belgians and German armies in Belgium in May 1940.

These are all original scenarios. Each scenario is complete and includes the original 1940 map the battle was fought over, the actual troops involved and the missions they had. These are not vague approximations but researched historical simulations. The 18-day campaign in Belgium is given scant study but featured bitter fighting in a wide variety of tactical actions. This volume of scenarios features battles rarely studied and pays tribute to the Belgian's gallant and often over looked efforts.

Optimised for wargaming rules that use one stand = one platoon but easily converted. 
Games range from small encounters to large set piece battles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rebel Yell, Yankee Hurrah!
Description:
10 ACW regimental scenarios from the Western Theatre 1861-64.

The most accurate information available on OOB's, unit strengths and weapons.

—description from the publisher

Name: Paper Pinball: Season 2 – Wave Wizard
Description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Paper Pinball (Metal Snail Idea Workshop)

Name: Paper Pinball: Season 2 – Fight Back the Winter
Description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Paper Pinball (Metal Snail Idea Workshop)

Name: Paper Pinball: Season 2 – Squishington Goes to Venus
Description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Paper Pinball (Metal Snail Idea Workshop)

Name: So Convenient for Hewing: The Skirmish System – Dark Age Historical Miniatures Game Rules
Description:
So Convenient for Hewing

Game rules for small scale battles played with historical miniatures set in the Dark Ages.

Scale:

     1 stand = 1-3 men. Typically 4-12 stands per unit.
     1" = 10 yards
     1 turn = 3-5 min


Features:

     use of action cards to control order of play
     command chits to activate units
     use existing basing
     point system to organize units
     four scenarios
     Quick Reference Sheet
     Rules illustrated for ease of understanding


—description from the publisher

Name: D100 Dungeon: The Lost Tome of Extraordinary Rules
Description:
The Lost Tome of Extraordinary Rules adds a wealth of new rules to any D100 Dungeon game.

BEAST MASTERY (tame and use companion pets)

NEW FIND TABLE (with 100 individual entries)

ARTISAN (an extensive item crafting system)

EASIER INVESTMENTS (a new table for investments)

COMBAT EXPERIENCE (get better at killing monsters)

ARCANISTS (60 new spells & the new Arcanist hero path)

PROPERTY (buy property for items you can’t part with)

QUICK ADVENTURER (generate adventurers with one roll)

CHAMPION HERO PATH (unlock the Champion hero path)

QUICK EQUIPMENT (hero path relevant starting equipment)

NEW MAPPING TABLE (squared areas for easier mapping)

SPECIAL BLUES (blue areas become lairs and challenges)

TREASURE TABLE D (items found from Special Blue areas)

—description from the designer

Name: Under Construction
Description: Under Construction is a roll'n write that puts you in the shoes of builders. Using the dice they will have to make the most points by judiciously placing the figures in the buildings, in order to finish first to get the bonuses. One page game.

Name: Triocolor
Description:
Trioocolor is a confrontation game for 2 players. Players will have to get points on each column of cards by defeating their opponent with the elements and combinations.
There are 3 versions with different boxes: Hollowtrio, Robotrio and Dragotrio

Name: Little Village
Description: Little Village is a PNP, created for Game Jam # 01 Do It Your Game. It is a roll'n write where the players will have to use the dice to build the best possible village, using the right shapes to fulfill the objectives.

Name: Assassin's Crisis
Description:
All players are ASSASSINS!

Use Assassinate, Track, and Hide cards, To survive the psychological battle of killing and killing!

This game is an analog game in which everyone becomes an assassin and plays against other players.

You can win by assassinating other player three times, but you must also think that they will assassinate you.

Use the Assassinate card to try to assassinate other players, the Track card to ensure assassination, and the Hide card to aim at the counter while preventing assassination from other players, to aim to win the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Supremacy 2020: Bombers&SLBMs
Description:
Fill out your nuclear triad with this all new expansion. The enemy´ s SLMBs can strike with enough speed and surprise to destroy your ICBMs in their silos!

Don‘t worry. Your bombers can deliver your revenge from the grave but only if they can get through the enemy‘s fighter screens.

With the right combination, nuclear war can be winnable.

—description from the publisher

Name: 斯くして我は独裁者に成れり－幕末－ (Kakushite ware ha dokusaisha ni nareri -Bakumatsu-)
Description:
æ–¯ãã—ã¦æˆ‘ã¯ç‹¬è£è€…ã«æˆã‚Œã‚Šï¼å¹•æœ«ï¼ (Kakushite ware ha dokusaisha ni nareri, "And Thus I Became a Dictator -Bakumatsu-") is a hidden role game where everyone starts in the same situation and it's possible to play successfully without lying. At the beginning of the game everyone has one of each of seven role cards; over five in-game days, players will give each other votes and discard roles until only one is left, which determines who wins.

Each turn ("day"), a player may choose to either vote or destroy a vote. When you vote you give a vote token to any other player and discard your role cards for the day face down. When you destroy a vote, you discard one vote from any player, including yourself, and your discards for the day are face up. At the end of each of the first three days, all discards are shuffled and revealed in total, so you can follow approximately what cards are still in play.

Roles have a variety of victory conditions.

This game is different from æ–¯ãã—ã¦æˆ‘ã¯ç‹¬è£è€…ã«æˆã‚Œã‚Š (Kakushite ware ha dokusaisha ni nareri, "And Thus I Became a Dictator...") as it includes a set of different cards, winning conditions and theme.

Note: The game can be played with up to 12 players, but one box only supports up to 6. For more than 6 players you will need to buy a second set and combine them.

–user summary

Name: Cot cot Panik
Description:
In this game, you have to make a chicken coop by placing fences on the board.
You also have to exclude the fox.
The cards are available in 3 levels.

—user summary

Brain teaser. The henhouse is under attack from the fox in this brain-teaser for one or two players! Who will be the first to work out where to put the barriers to protect the hens from the marauding fox? A game of tactics and thought that also requires a touch of speed!

—description from the back of the box

Name: The City of Hemloch
Description:
Return to the city of constant shadow in this final iteration of Hemloch.
â€‹
Using a mix of area control with a pinch of deck building, players use Minions to assert influence across the four Districts and acquire additional Minions.  Each Day, each player receives 3 Actions.  These actions may be used to gain new Minions, or play Minions to the 4 different Districts of Hemloch to assert Influence and possibly trigger special abilities.
â€‹
At the end of eight Days, players score points for the Districts they control, as well the Minions in their decks, with some being worth more than others.

—description from the designer

Name: Frosthaven: Solo Scenarios
Description:
Master all 16 of the Frosthaven classes with this all-new set of scenarios and item rewards. Each scenario is dedicated to a specific class and designed around their strengths and weaknesses to provide the ultimate challenge.

—description from the publisher

Name: Frosthaven: Removable Sticker Set
Description: This set of vinyl stickers replaces all the normal ones in Frosthaven. If you don’t like the permanence of normal stickers, these vinyl stickers can be removed at any time with no damage to the components.

Name: Age of Valor: Crimean War 1854 - 1856
Description:
Crimean War 1854 - 1856, the Campaign for Sevastopol is an independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion chapter or mini-module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rule changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts (to include an entry for Harry Flashman as a British commander) as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Any changes unique to the Crimean War, the subject of this expansion set, are included for both the conflict overall, and the included battles of Alma, Inkermann, Traktir Bridge and Assault on the Malakov Redoubt scenarios.

The AOV product line is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 36 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at http://tinyurl.com/AOV-Crimea-Reference-Portal.

-description from the designer.

Name: Antietam Army Lists: A Wargamer's Guide to the Opposing Forces Engaged on America's Bloodiest Day
Description:
Order of Battle for the Battle of Antietam / Sharpsburg during the American Civil War.

Includes:

     regimental strength estimates,
     regimental and battery armament,
     suggested morale ratings,
     a sample scenario for Johnny Reb III,
     bibliography, and
     human interest stories from the battle participants.


—description from the publisher

Name: Witching Weald
Description:
Witching Weald is a short Programmed movement game for 1-10 players. The game was release as a free print and play for those who were isolated in the COVID-19 outbreak.

The Witching Weald lies deep and dark. Few are those who have ventured in to the heart of its thicket and returned. Even fewer, those who returned with their sanity intact. In the depth of the forest many peculiar ingredients can be found. Some are vital for a witches concoctions and thus their immortality. But not even witches dare walk into the forest in their flesh. Instead they summon their familiars to do their bidding. Witches can only control their familiars for a short period of time. If a witch loses control of her familiar she may lose important ingredients she sought to collect.
Therefore planning ahead is of the essence.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle of Burnwood
Description:
Requires 1 standard dice and some counters for players.

Battle of Burnwood is an intro fantasy board game, with a blend of strategy, luck, chance and chaotic fun. With wild Wolves, greedy Goblins, swashbuckling Pirates and awesome Assassins, its a dangerous place indeed.

Each player is a gang leader of 5 Character cards, racing to collect Objects and be the first to complete their Quest. However, as the game progresses, the world can become more hazardous as random folk up for a battle can end up being placed around the various locations on the play map.

With 44 unique Characters, 18 specialized Objects and 24 overlapping Quests, game play is different and exciting every time!

—description from the designer

Name: Draw the Line
Description: Each team has a sketcher and a guesser. With a pencil, the sketcher must draw a mystery word by connecting icons on his easel. Then, by making sounds and gestures to his teammate, he must have the guesser sketch the drawing by making him connect the icons that he acts and noises. You must act quickly since the objective is to be the first team to find the mystery word reproduced in the drawing.

Name: Kingdomino: The Court
Description:
Kingdomino: The Court is a free print-and-play expansion for Kingdomino or Queendomino and contains a small board, 59 resource tokens and 25 characters and building tiles.

At the begin of the game, the 25 character and building tiles are shuffled and three are revealed. The remaining pile is placed faced down.

The game is played as usual, but when the dominoes have been drawn, the following resources are added to each square without a crown: wheat field – wheat; forest – wood; lake – fish; meadow – sheep.

At the end of each round, a player may pay resources. Either 2 different ones to recruit a character or build a building from the small board or 4 different ones to choose a tile from the face-down pile.

The obtained character or building can only be placed on tiles without crowns and resources. Buildings give additional crowns and can only be placed in the appropriate type of land, e. g. a mill on a wheat field; characters give additional points depending on surrounded resource tokens, crowns or other characters and can be placed on any land square without crowns or resource tokens.

Name: Digital Mecha Warriors
Description:
Digital Mecha Warriors is a game of giant robot tabletop combat.  It is a tactical miniatures game where one player takes the role of the evil Pax Imperialis and the other players are Federation Mecha pilots.  The game has a multiple mission campaign and uses an 8-bit video game art style.

—user summary

Name: Space Park: Spotlight – The Board Gamer's Guide to the Galaxy
Description:
Originally available from the Promo Paradise Kickstarter.

4 XP

Card Text: Draw two cards from the deck of STARLIGHT STATION. Keep one and place the other back
Families: Books: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

Name: Hero Master: An Epic Game of Epic Fails – Indecent Exposure Promo
Description:
A promo card, which was available from Promo Paradise Kickstarter.

Flavor Text: Martyn the dandy always dressed to impress, with puffy sleeves, tight corsets and bell-toed shoes. It did mean he was prone to epic wardrobe malfunctions, which weren't popular in tight dungeon corridors.

Game Text: Reveal your hand to the other Heroes.

Card Type: Critical Fail

Name: Crossed Sabers: Cavalry Scenarios from the Gettysburg Campaign
Description:
Twelve regimental-level scenarios covering cavalry actions from the Gettysburg Campaign of the American Civil War.

Scenarios include three for Brandy Station and two from Gettysburg, as well as Aldie, Middleburg. Upperville, Hunterstown, Hanover, and East Cavalry Field plus others.

Designed for Johnny Reb 3, but adaptable for Regimental Fire & Fury, Rally Round the Flag, Civil War Commander, Gettysburg Soldiers Rules, and other similar rules systems.

—description from the publisher

Name: Touched With Fire: American Civil War Miniature Wargaming Scenarios
Description:
Twelve regimental-level scenarios for the American Civil War.

Scenarios include Hoover's Gap, Gettysburg, Antietam, Chantilly / Ox Hill, Monroe's Crossroads, Newtonia, Fair Oaks, and others.

Designed for Johnny Reb 3, but adaptable for Regimental Fire & Fury, Civil War Commander, Rally Round the Flag, Mr. Lincoln's War, Gettysburg Soldiers, and many other rules systems.

Name: Gettysburg Soldiers: American Civil War Miniature Rules
Description:
Gettysburg Soldiers gaming rulebook for the ACW
Designed to recreate historical battles or create new ones.
The game has special provisions to simulate the element of surprise, the ebb and flow of momentum, and the fog of battle.

Basing is flexible and compatible with most other rulesets.

The Gettysburg Soldiers rules use Infantry Regiments, Cavalry Regiments and Artillery Batteries as the basic units of battle. Each player in a game assumes the role of a General or commander, and directs the actions of the various troops on the tabletop battlefield. Players will decide when and were to maneuver their troops to aggressively take the battle to the enemy and when to react defensively if troops under their command retreat or rout. Victory or defeat is determined by winning the objectives of a game scenario, inflicting more causalities, and controlling portions of the battlefield.

Scales:
figures: 10mm-15mm-25mm
1 mini = 50 men
1 cannon model = 1 arty battery
1" = 25 yd

Name: Above the Clouds!: Resolution 181
Description:
Resolution 181 is an expansion for the Above the Clouds!  air-combat miniature wargame rules.

It covers the Arab-Israeli conflict from 1948-1983.

Resolution 181 is intended to provide enough background information for Above the Clouds! aficionados to generate interesting missions set in the various clashes of the Arab-Israeli conflict.  
This conflict has varied over time including all-out warfare involving the very survival of the Israeli state, lower-level conflicts involving mere one-off raids, and even sustained air combat attrition campaigns.

     The early conflicts (the 1948 and 1956 wars) can be played using Above the Clouds! alone, but the remaining conflicts represented in Resolution 181 will require players to have the Missile Age expansion.   
     Resolution 181 consists of three major parts, a timeline to familiarize gamers with the background of the conflict, a section breaking down the major conflicts and the forces which were available to the participants, and the game components required for using your miniatures to fight in these conflicts.


Game components include 53 APDs (12 of which were previously published in other expansions) and 26 APD variants, some of which are:

     F-84F Thunderstreak (“Super Hog”)
     F-15 Eagle
     F-16 Falcon
     Hawker Hunter
     DeHavilland Vampire, FB.5
     DeHavilland Venom / Sea Venom
     Mystere IVa
     Mirage III / Mirage V
     Mirage F.1
     MiG-23 “Flogger”
     MiG-25 “Foxbat”
     Su-7 “Fitter”
     Su-17/20/22 “Fitter”
     Tu-16 “Badger"
     S-199 Mezek (“Mule”),
     Kfir (“Cub”)
     Nesher


Air-to-air missile systems include Shafrir, Python, R.530, AA-2, AA-7, AIM-7 and AIM-9 (a total of 18 models/versions).

Air Defense system include SA-2, SA-3, SA-6, Roland and HAWK SAM systems; as well as ZSU-23/4 and ZSU-57/2 anti-aircraft guns.

—description from the publisher

Name: World Conflict: Modern Combat
Description:
The primary goal of this game design was to reimagine the classic board games "Risk" and "Axis & Allies" by targeting and replacing or eliminating their least enjoyed mechanics and elements, while retaining and building around their best qualities (particularly "Risk".

The game is played on a map of Earth, including all seven continents, broken into 8 different land "Regions" and 6 ocean "Regions". Similar to Risk or A&A, players control factions and compete for power, influence, and resources and use dice to resolve conflicts.

Unlike the parent games, Global War embraces a multi-purpose card system whereby new reinforcements can be claimed OR players can interact and modify dice rolls - even on other player's turns.

Also unlike the parent games, Global War has a "double elimination" mechanic; where a newly eliminated faction enters a "Piracy" stage - where they can utilize the game's built-in naval warfare mechanics to continue influencing the final outcome of the game (and potentially still win!)

The game also has a variety of selectable win conditions and is semi-modular to allow for simpler, quick strategic gameplay, or more complex, longer games that have a similar feel to classic wargaming.

—description from the designer

Name: Totalne zasmoczenie
Description:
Almanak the wizard used the Total Soaked Amulet and took control of the inhabitants of Dragon Forest. Now, with his army, he is storming City after Wall to overthrow King Jacenty! Five heroes: dragon Gniewko, princess Izabela, knight Sergius, steed Lomot and Fochmistrzynia Rozczesalska face them!

A game of perceptiveness, cleverness and speed, the plot of which is set in the world of books from the series "Dragon Tales" by Marcin Mortka. Addictive, fast-paced gameplay will provide a lot of excitement to the youngest players and fans of the adventures of Izabela and Gniewek.

Purpose of the game:

Players release dragons from the power of the Amulet by sealing Dragon cards. A correctly sealed card goes to the player and brings him points in the form of crowns (symbols on the card). The player with the most crowns wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

PiÄ…tka bohaterów: smok Gniewko, królewna Izabela, rycerz Sergiusz, rumak Åomot i Fochmistrzyni Rozczesalska stajÄ… im naprzeciw!

Gra na spostrzegawczoÅ›Ä‡, spryt i szybkoÅ›Ä‡, której fabuÅ‚a osadzona jest w Å›wiecie ksiÄ…Å¼ek z serii „Smocze opowieÅ›ci” autorstwa Marcina Mortki. WciÄ…gajÄ…ca, szybka rozgrywka dostarczy wielu emocji najmÅ‚odszym graczom i fanom przygód Izabeli i Gniewka.
