—description from the publisher

Name: Spook Mansion
Description:
Spook Mansion is an asymmetrical two player game.
One player is the investigator trying to escape and the other is the house itself attempting to ensure that this does not happen.

The investigator player uses action points to move through the haunted mansion trying to escape as the the house player places cards to expand the house or blocks of exits to draw more cards.

The investigator wins if he escapes before he runs out action points. Three times he can regain all his action points but there is a price, for a ghost will appear.

—description from the designer

Name: ARTributes
Description:
Players take turns drawing pictures based on chosen descriptive words. The rest of the players or teams try to guess what the picture is to win points. The person or team that reaches 15 points first wins.

Skills Focus :  Vocabulary & Language Use,  Imagination & Creativity

Name: Mens Erger Je Niet! Dierenvriendjes
Description:
Dutch

Het klassieke Mens Erger Je Niet! spel voor de allerkleinsten! Op de dobbelsteen staan symbolen die corresponderen met de velden op het bord. De kinderen hoeven dus nog niet te kunnen tellen om al mee te kunnen spelen!

Er zijn twee varianten; één voor de echte kleintjes waarbij alleen de pionnen thuisgebracht moeten worden, en één waarin ook tegenstanders van het bord gegooid mogen worden.

Geschikt van 2 tot 4 spelers van 4 tot 8 jaar.

English

The classic Ludo game for the little ones! On the dice are symbols corresponding to the spaces on the board. So the children do not have to be able to count to play!

There are two variants; one for the real little ones where only the pawns have to be brought home, and one in which opponents can also be thrown off the board.

Suitable for 2 to 4 players from 4 to 8 years old.

Name: Comic Book Crisis
Description:
Comic Book Crisis is a cooperative worker placement/action game for 1-4 players that can be played on ANY comic book thanks to a patent-pending method.

You play as a member of the heroic B-TEAM, superheroes who attempt to thwart an evil villain's plot. Place your hero's poses onto the comic page, collect resources, and spend them to activate your powers against the villain and their henchmen! If you can work together against the forces of evil before the story reaches its end, you WIN!

Comic Book Crisis comes with four superheroes, each with their own unique pose tokens and deck of power cards. The game also comes with several villains, each of increasing difficulty and their own deck of schemes.

Comic Book Crisis comes with an EXCLUSIVE comic book but the most exciting feature is that thanks to a patent-pending method, COMIC BOOK CRISIS can be played on ANY comic book ever published! You can literally play hundreds of thousands of games of Comic Book Crisis and never have the same experience twice!

—description from the designer

Name: Rallye des Herzens
Description:
The theme of the game is a rally through the Sahel Zone. The rally starts and ends in Dakar. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to return to Dakar wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Operation Rösselsprung 1944
Description:
"Operation Rösselsprung" is an anti-partisan operation launched by German forces against the Yugoslav resistance between May 25 and June 3, 1944. This combined operation between the air and ground forces aims to seize - dead or alive - the chief of the resistance Josip Broz known as "Tito", whose hiding place was located in the village of Drvar in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The operational plan, which mobilizes 20,000 soldiers, is the responsibility of the XV Mountain Corps as well as the air forces. The first phase of the raid is led by airborne troops (paratroopers and gliders), the SS-fallschirmjäger battalion 500, a sort of disciplinary battalion. The second phase notably involved the 7th SS Prinz Eugen division, the Brandenburg regiment and its Chetnik subordinates, several reconnaissance Kampfgruppe as well as Croatian forces.

"Operation Rösselsprung 1944" is a solitaire tactical wargame appearing in the French Vae Victis magazine #151 (special game edition). The game is edited under ziplock and contains an A3-size map depicting Drvar (in Bosnia-Herzegovinia) and surroundings, 108 counters (25 counters representing the SS-fallschirmjäger bataillion 500 –- and 54 counters for the communist partisans). The rules are included in a separate 16 pages A5-sized booklet.

The systems uses the improved rules of the "Bruneval 1942" (VaeVictis #104) and "Commando 4 in action: Dieppe 1942" (VaeVictis #131) to simulate the airborne phase of the operation.

This game system developed for the "Raids" series is only playable in solo ; very easy to learn and fun to play ! The "Artificial intelligence" automatically manages Yugoslav actions while the player is in charge of German actions.

The map is point-to-point, one to several hundred meters apart. A game turn is equivalent to 2 hours during the day and 5 hours at night, the scenario begins at 6:00 am on May 25, 1944 and ends at 12:00 am on May 26, that is 12 game turns. One counter represents a full strenght, 35 to 40 German paratroopers, a company of 20 to 100 Yugoslav partisans, an officer, two anti-aircraft machine guns, or two Italian tanks L3-35.

Would you be smart enough to capture Tito, maximize the prizes and minimize your losses ? It’s up to you Captain !

Name: Age of Valor: Risorgimento 1859 - 1861
Description:
Age of Valor: Risorgimento 1859 - 1861, depicting the 2d Italian War of Independence, is an independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion chapter or mini-module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rule changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Any changes unique to the Risorgimento 1859 - 1861, the subject of this expansion set, are included for both the conflict overall, and the included battles of Magenta, Solferino, San Martino and Volturno scenarios.

The AOV product line is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 38 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at http://tinyurl.com/AOV-Res-1859-Research-Portal.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Spitzbub
Description:
Spitzbub is a bidding and bluffing game with 66 cards: 9 times the number cards 1 to 6 and 12 jokers, which can copy any number card.

Each player has 6 cards on their hand. It is played in turn.

The player picks one or more cards from their hand and the value of the cards, e. g. two times wolf (value 3). The player must claim that all of their cards have the same value, but may lie. Jokers can adopt any value. Then the player draws up to 6 cards in hand. The player to the left may accept or reject the claim. If they accept the claim, they take the cards in their hand.

Each bid must be higher than the previous one, either with the same number of cards with a higher value or with a higher number of cards with any value.

Name: Schmitz 21
Description:
Schmitz 21 is a Blackjack inspired card game where players are playing cards to a collective discard trying to be the one to reach exactly 21.

The game comes with 55 cards: 10 times the numbers 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 [yes, there is no 4!] and 5 times the number 10.

Each player starts with four cards. A central deck is formed from the rest of the cards. It is played in turn. The player plays one card, calls the total value of all played cards and draws one card. If the sum of the played cards is exactly 21, that player wins all played cards to a face-down pile. A player cannot play a card if the total value would exceed 21. If a player cannot play a card, the previous player wins the played cards.

The game ends when the deck is empty and all hand cards have been played. The player with the most collected cards wins the game.

Name: Shiloh: First day
Description:
SHILOH: First day is a ASCARI Scenario depicting the attack led by Gen Johnston on April 6th 1862 at 11am in the left flank of the US Army.

The attack towards the Bell crossroads was successful and the Confederates continued to push back the US Army. Just the sudden death of the CS Commander stopped the advance.


     Scenario rules,
     a colorful A3 map
     and nice counters wait for you 


Remember that in order to play this Scenario you will need the ASCARI rules!

—description from the publisher

Name: Wörterdiebe Flora & Fauna
Description:
Wörterdiebe Flora & Fauna is a simple word recognition game, with 100 square cards with shuffled words from the categories mammals; birds; reptiles and fish; and plants.

In each round the top card is revealed and the players have to reconstruct the words from the letters. The player who find the word first, wins the card. When all cards have been distributed, the player with the most cards wins the game.

Name: Wörter Fuchs
Description: Wörter Fuchs contains 5 long word dice which have five letters per side. The players have to write down as many valid words as possible using the letters on these dice, until the hourglass (2 minutes) expires. There are two modes to play the game: either take exactly one letter per die or form a pillar from the dice and the letters must be used in the correct order from top to bottom. The player with the most valid words wins. Players with a unique word gain additional points. The number of used dice in the second variant can be varied.

Name: Rolling Alnite
Description:
Unabashedly inspired by Jamey Stegmaier’s Rolling Realms game, we have developed a simple Roll & Write game featuring the Haus Alnite drag king/queen personalities.

The theme is to fill out as many of the sections as possible (earning a geometric shape) to flesh out a drag persona on the figure at the bottom of the sheet. Your score improves the more shapes you have that match each other.

Any number of players can play this game simultaneously. Each player needs 4 standard dice (6-sided) and a printed copy of the sheet to fill out. You can download the image of the sheet and load it into Google’s JamBoard, any photo-editing app or graphic design software where you can mark it up as needed.

—description from the publisher

Name: Adder: Realtime Chase System
Description:
The Vurdes Aerial Combat Institute has emerged as the premier pilot training facility in the galaxy. In order to gain admission, you've passed written tests and aced your interviews, but one final hurdle lies in your path: Adder. Can you best your rivals in this game designed to test your wits and reflexes?

—description from the rulebook


Adder is a real-time strategy dexterity game in which players place cards to extend their own stack of cards to chase and catch the opponent's cards while the opponent is doing the same thing.

—user summary

Name: 18TraXX 2020: Great Plains Railroading
Description:
TraXX. That sounds like a good name for a railroad company! Well, let’s make it so. The game, the convention that inspired it, and a key company in the game, are all called TraXX. It is the design intention that the TraXX railroad be an important feature of the game. TraXX is player-controlled and partially government-subsidized company that assumes control of troubled railroad companies. Headquartered in Denver, well, that’s where the TraXX convention is held every year, TraXX can spread out across the plains and in so doing relieve struggling company presidents of their financial burdens. TraXX 2020 is intended to be a “lively” game as many companies will come and go during the game and TraXX may be used for good or otherwise. Additional “McGuffins” include minor railroad companies, boom towns on the plains, the Bailey Yard, and Pullman cars. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1830 to play the game.

—description from the designer

Name: 18 Grand Junction
Description: The McGuffins in 18 Grand Junction, an 18xx game, include a restrictive track set and the mountainous Colorado terrain. The yellow plain track only upgrades only to the complex green plain track (16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, and 22). After all, it is the Rocky Mountains, you can’t just build track where ever you want. The other primary McGuffin is Company Presidents. The presidents give a special ability to a railroad company in a manner similar to private companies would (there are no private companies in 18 Grand Junction). When a company starts, it selects a president. The first rank of presidents is “retired” in Phase 3 (brown) and each company selects a new president at the end of its next operation. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1846 to play the game.

1888 is an 18xx game. Players operate their railroads in Jefferson and New Suffolk, two fictional states within the United States. “Event Cards” are a nice way to add historical flavor to a game, but a deck of random events being flipped over each round is not what we’re after. The train deck is stacked with event cards that are intended to entice players into changing their train buying habits. Additional “McGuffins” include two-sided train cards with a more powerful train on the reverse, and unconventionally, priority deal established at the beginning of each stock round. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1830 to play the game.

Name: 1883 Express d'Orient
Description: 1883 Express d'Orient is an 18xx game set between Budapest and Bucharest, players control companies that are headed by different “company presidents”. Two company president cards are randomly assigned at the beginning of the game to each company. These cards give the company a specific ability from phase 2 through phase 4 and another ability from phase 5 until the end of the game. Additional “McGuffins” include giving the players the ability to skip the last train of a type in order to buy the first train of the next type, private companies that pay more revenue once connected to the rail network, and a non-player investor that buys and sells shares based upon the current status of each company. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1830 to play the game.

Name: Echo Actual
Description:
Echo Actual is a wargame that fits well between the tabletop simulations and war/boardgames on your shelf. The system is adaptable for playing on a variety of maps you already own with a soon-to-be-released bundle of OPORD scenarios designed specifically for Echo Actual.

A number of features help Echo Actual stand out from other wargame offerings, including;

     A combined arms game, the system is designed to allow players the selection of a specific Commander before assembling a mission-specific force with Sections, Teams and Modifications that can be equipped, further pushing the specialized capabilities of each unit.
     The entire force must stay connected to the Communications Net to avoid the horrific consequences of a Blue-on-Blue attack.
     At the beginning of the game, units are deployed face down - when spotted, they are revealed!
     Some units have highly specific skills. The Electronic Warfare unit can cripple an enemy communications net. The Engineer Section can build a number of Fortifications.


The Core Rulebook includes print and play instructions to get you in the fight!

Tokens for everything listed in the Combined Arms List make for a quick start up. Also included are instructions for creating a set of DIY tokens in case a player didn't have access to a printer.

The first installment of Echo Actual will serve as the platform for a number of expansions.

—description from the publisher

Name: 1871:BC Constitution Railways
Description:
Constitution Railways
This is an 1846-based game, set in British Columbia.  Differences from 1846 include company-owned track, borders which count against train length, and sea dits.

Name: Vinyl: Top Shelf – Rare Album: Funkhousers Promo
Description:
Promo originally available as part of the Promo Paradise 2019 Kickstarter.

This is a Top Shelf Rare Album promo for the game Vinyl.

When players have acquired two Collection Reward Tokens, they may flip them over and exhuast them to take a Top Shelf Album Card. The player will have the right to perform the action on the Top Shelf Albums on a subsequent turn. When a Top Shelf Album is removed from the Top Shelf Rack, a new one is drawn and placed in the drafting row.

Abilities on the Top Shelf cards are to be used one time only. Once the Top shelf power has been used, flip the Top Shelf album over to show that you have used that power.

Rare Album: At the end of the game, this Top Shelf Album is worth twelve victory points.

Name: Re-Chord: The Rolling Bones Promo Card
Description:
Promo originally available through 2019 Promo Paradise Kickstarter.

During set up, shuffle this promo into the Song Card Deck.

Flavor Text: The Rolling Bones: You can't always hit what you want.

Card Text: Chords E-D-A

Value: 14 Fame

Automa: Wylde/Discard 1 Chord Card/Red

Name: Unfair: Office Intern Promo Card
Description:
Sneak peek card - only valid until replaced by the final version.

     Available from the Promo Paradise Kickstarter campaign


Final version now available in the Comicbook theme pack of the CHKO expansion.
This sneak peek version has OFFICIALLY EXPIRED.

Shuffle this card into the relevant deck(s) during setup and proceed as normal.
Add no more than one copy of any sneak peek or promo card.

Office Intern (Staff Member)
If this staff member is dismissed you may immediately search the Park deck for a staff member card with up to the same points value, reveal it, and put it into your hand.

So enthusiastic, so hard-working! So easily replaced.

Name: Godzilla Rampage: Kaiju Unleashed
Description:
Game Objective – Players choose Kaiju and battle each other in an all-out melee till one player has defeated all of the other player’s Kaiju and is declared The King of the Monsters!

Starting the Game – Taking turns, one at a time each player chooses one Battle Kaiju for their team till all players have a total of 3 Battle Kaiju chosen.
•    One at a time each player chooses a section of the game board. Place them together to form a (4-part, section) game board.
•    Players start at opposite ends of the board with their characters spaced apart.
•    Play rock, paper, and scissors to decide which player goes first. Game play then continues with the player to the left.
•    Shuffle and place face down off to the side of the board within reach of all players the Kaiju Assist Cards. 
o    Each player may draw 1 card and keep it hidden from all other players. 
•    Each player takes 3 Rampage Counter Cards and places them next to their kaiju. 
•    Place 2 Military Vehicles on the game board in the designated areas. Refer to Military Vehicles below for placement/respawn info.
•    If you have a kaiju that can either fly or burrow, take a Burrowing & Flying Counter Card for each kaiju.

Game Round – After each player has had all of their kaiju go, a round has passed. 
•    During a turn, each player’s kaiju goes. Players may choose to do nothing with a kaiju on their turn if they wish to not move it or do a battle.

What to do during your Turn
At the start of a player’s turn, they must announce which one of the following actions they are going to do to start their turn for that particular kaiju.

Battle – Each player rolls 2 dice and the highest die roll wins. The defender wins ties.
•    Each Battle Kaiju Card and some select Kaiju Assist Cards have a Wound Counter on them to keep track of when a Kaiju receives a hit. 
•    Once a player’s Battle Kaiju receives a KO, that Kaiju is no longer in play. Remove that Kaiju from the board and flip over its Kaiju Battle Card. 
o    Kaiju Assist Cards: Some require being defeated. Once defeated, follow the same rules as above for Kaiju Battle Cards.

Grab/Throw – Grab a Building/Vehicle; roll 4+. To throw a grabbed object; roll the die, the die amount rolled is the x number of spaces you may throw that object. 
•    Destroying Buildings & Bridges: They are destroyed when a player’s Kaiju attacks them.  Attacked Buildings/Bridges are destroyed on a die roll of 4+.
•    Once a Building/Vehicle or Bridge has been attacked or used as a ranged attack they are no longer in that space and are considered destroyed. Place a game logo chip on that space.
Hint: Use objects as ranged attack against other player’s Kaiju. A player’s Kaiju takes a hit from a building on a die roll of 3+ and a hit from a vehicle on a die roll of 5+.

Melee Attack (Punch/Kick) – A standard attack against another player’s Kaiju. Refer to Battle for info.

Kaiju Battle Card Special Ability – An attack unique to that Kaiju that can be done against another player’s Kaiju.
•    Range Attack Ability: Some characters can perform range attacks. These characters can aim at an opponent’s Kaiju that are in line of sight.
o    Line of Sight is an imaginary line drawn from the center of one Kaiju’s head to the center of another Kaiju’s head. If any part of the imaginary line touches or crosses a Kaiju or a building, the Line of Sight is blocked.
•    Kaiju must wait x number of rounds before they can regain their range ability back; depending on distance they used their attack.
o    Each Kaiju who can perform a Range Attack has a Range Ability Counter on their card to help players keep track of when their Kaiju can perform the ability again.

Movement – Roll the die and see how many spaces you can move a particular Kaiju. This action can be combined with any of the above on a player’s turn.
•    Players can either use regular movement or burrow/fly movement on the board and then either do battle, grab/throw or a range attack.

Sharing Spaces – Only a player’s Kaiju may share a space with one other Kaiju they are using at a time. Other players Kaiju may not move onto space with another player’s Kaiju.
•    Tails & Wings: Some Kaiju figures have tails/wings that extend into an adjacent square. The Kaiju is NOT considered to be in the square which its tail/wings occupy. If another Kaiju moves into the tail/wings occupied space, either move it off the side to make room or turn the Kaiju figure in the opposite facing direction.

Military Vehicles – These vehicles are sent to defend the city against Kaiju. They seek out the nearest Kaiju and battle them.
•    During setup, place only 2 Military Vehicles on the game board two spaces away from the middle and facing opposite ends of the board.
o    There will only ever be 4 Military Vehicles on the board at once.
•    During a player’s offensive turn, the other player or players (defense) move the Military Vehicles. Any time a Kaiju moves visible to a Military Vehicle, that Military Vehicle will move two spaces towards that Kaiju. Buildings and other Kaiju block Military Line of Sight.
o    If the Kaiju moves out of view of a Military Vehicle, that Vehicle will not continue to pursue the Kaiju.
•    Military Vehicle Firing (attack) distance: May fire (attack) any Kaiju from a distance of 3 spaces away; long as they are in line of sight.
•    Destroying Military Vehicles: They get hit by a Kaiju’s Melee/Ranged Attack, including Thrown Objects or a Kaiju enters the same Space they are in.
o    Military Vehicles will spawn at beginning of every round (unless the max number is already on the board) at one of the game setup locations. Player(s) who destroyed a vehicle the previous round or have the fewer number of kaiju on the board will be the one to place a vehicle on the board.
Hint: Use Military Vehicles as projectiles against other player’s Kaiju. A player’s Kaiju takes a hit from a Military Vehicle on a die roll of 5+.

Kaiju Assist Cards – Players can only have 1 Kaiju Assist Card at a time. It can be played at any time, depending on what is written on the card. 
•    After a Kaiju Assist Card has been played or is no longer in play, place it in a discard pile. Once all of the cards have been used, shuffle the cards and place them face down like at the start of the game.
•    If a player draws a Kaiju Assist Card that they do not wish to use or hold on to, they can discard it at the end of their turn. At the start of the next round and it is their turn, they will draw a new card like normal.

Rampage Mode – As a player’s Kaiju wins offensive battles, its Rampage Counter will go up 1 level. After Winning 5 Battles that player’s Kaiju will reach Max Rampage Level. 
•    On your next turn (or any other offensive turn) go on a Total Rampage against the opponent's Kaiju! 
•    You have 3 Battle Energy to use within your kaiju’s Rampage. A standard Battle (Punch/Kick) is worth: 1 Battle Energy and ability off your Kaiju's Battle Card is worth: 2 Battle Energy.
•    Each player has a Rampage Counter Card next to their Kaiju Battle Card to help you keep track of your Kaiju’s Rampage level.

Burrowing & Flying Kaiju Special Abilities – Some Kaiju have the unique special ability to be able to either burrow or fly. When a player uses this Kaiju’s ability, they can ignore Buildings or Bridges that may be in there way.
•    At the start of the player’s turn, they must announce which Kaiju they’re going to use and if they’re going to use the Burring & Flying ability prior to rolling the die for movement.
•    Kaiju cannot end their turn under or top of bridges, buildings or water spaces. A player may end either turn on the same space an ally kaiju only.
•    In addition, a player’s Kaiju can do pass through another player’s kaiju that is in a space.
o    This ability cannot be used during Capture the Flag scenario.
•    Player’s will keep track of when they can use this special ability by using the Burrowing & Flying Counter Card. A player’s kaiju will need to wait up to 6 rounds (depending on the x-number of spaces traveled) before using this special ability again.

Water Spaces – If a Kaiju is passing through water spaces -1 is subtracted from their die movement. Kaiju using the flying ability can ignore this rule.

Military Vehicles, Kaiju Assist Cards and Rampage Mode are all extra optional game features to Godzilla Rampage: Kaiju Unleashed.

Name: Forgotten Legends: The Worm Emperor
Description:
Forgotten Legends : The Worm Emperor is a high fantasy game set in the magical world of Aiine. Your goal is to prepare a foothold into an uncharted territory and sustain your war effort. Find and defeat the Prince of Despair, his majesty, the Worm Emperor, by breaking the three magic seals which protect his fortress and challenge him to a deadly duel.

Lured by the promise of earthly riches and eternal knowledge in an uncharted region of the realm, the party of Heroes must battle chimeric creatures, flesh and dark thoughts mingled together by magic and molded into fierce monsters born from the depths of a dreadful mind, complete trials which will reveal the very fabric of their soul, fight, scavenge, loot and trade to survive the journey and ultimately face the abominable overlord, the Master of Lies and Prince of Despair, his majesty, the Worm Emperor. 

Replayability : The core of the game is entirely player driven. Heroes decide (individually or as a group) where the game is heading, from fighting an epic monster down to trading and building new dwellings in the castle they settled in. Many paths lead to victory.

 Automa System:  You move, his majesty, the Worm Emperor and his acolytes are moving as well. The enemy army is already on the march to conquer the regions and consolidate the domain of despair. Sooner or later, your armies will meet.

Castles and Outposts: A game within a game. You may start the adventure from any sub-region on the outskirts of the adventure map. Once settled in, you can build new dwellings, trade in the market for items, recruit creatures, complete puzzles and more.

Unique Adventure Map: Divided into three major regions and a fourth special inner region (controlled by the Worm Emperor) and counting more than 65 independent sub-regions the party of Heroes will have the freedom to explore a uniquely designed map with one-of-a-kind characteristics. Conquer cities, acquire resources, uncover mysteries and secret locations.

Modular Battlefield: Constantly changing its configuration depending on the sub-region you are exploring. The setup is randomly created each time your party clashes with a monster or a group of monsters. Terrain obstacles, power-up spots or de-buffs areas will hinder you or help you win the day.

---description from the publisher

Name: Life of Cats
Description:
Your cat lives a secret life you don't know about.
Although she looks like just an average cute house cat, she has enemies outside of her territory.
Her one desire is to rule over her enemies in the neighboring territories.
So every day, after you have left the house, she secretly sneaks out to use her special house cat abilities in the five other territories to defeat the other cats and rule them all.
Will the house-cat be able to concur all of the territories and become the leader of the land? Or will one of the other cats take control and send the house-cat back home? It's all up to you! Assume the role of one of the cats and use his or her special abilities to take control of other territories by earning points. The first cat to win fifteen points will become the leader of all the territories! Good luck, and may the best cat win!

Name: Bali: Jungle of Jembrana
Description:
Bali: Jungle of Jembrana is the third major expansion for Bali and introduces a few new aspects to the game. 
The players will go into the dense jungle on exploration.Go on an expedition into the lush hills and plateaus around the Village of Tani, surrounded by vibrant plant life and shy local critters.

There are 4 jungle plans in the box, 4 adventurer meeples (one in each playing color), 4 starting 'adventurer' cards, 10 adventurer cards for in the deck and 43 treasure markers.

Use the adventurer cards as smart as you can, explore the jungle, use hidden caves, collect treasures and use them in your advantage.

–description from publisher

Name: ETEREA
Description:
Originally it was Time, a tumult of uncontrollable energies, then Space, an infinite fabric in search of a foothold, then Matter arrived as a parasite ready to infest the rules of the Game. Finally she came, blossomed by a tear of light, which gave rise to all living beings, now she has been imprisoned by her power-hungry children and you will have to free her. ETEREA princess has been chained to the heart of the first world, her children, custodians of the six dimensions , they overturned the throne determined to master the fundamental principles to be able to reign over the entire universe. What was once a thriving planet is now a distant memory, that place where life was born has died out, the Vital Essences, now lost, they no longer generate beings and the thread that binds all the galaxies is corroded and close to splitting. The last hope is a handful of Architects, faithful heralds of the princess, designers of all perceptible dimensions and im palpable. Only they will have the ardor to undertake a mission to the limit of the impossible to try to subjugate the six tyrants, take their keys and free ETEREA from an unacceptable fate; if they fail, everything will be lost, the universe, as we know it, will cease to exist giving way to despair, chaos, ruin.

In ETEREA you are one of the architects who will attempt the enterprise to recover the keys, guarded by the six Bosses who govern the six dimensions: Water, Fire, Wind, Earth, Cosmos and Oblivion, to free the princess and save the whole ETEREA is a game divided into two parts: in the first you will have to wander through the six dimensions trying to reconstruct the Requirements, now swept away by the tyrants, to repopulate them; doing this will allow you to acquire Requirement cards and Artifacts, which are essential to succeed in the mission; to create the Requirements you will need careful planning in the dice roll and a careful use of certain skills or Vocations. In the second part you will have to face the Bosses and recover the keys, in doing so you will have to build your dice set , thanks to what I learned in the first part, and launch yourself in a desperate attempt to defeat them in an unequal duel, but thanks to a careful strategy, nothing will be impossible. There is more, always keep an eye on the time that passes , you will only have eighteen hours, a single day on ETEREA, then everything will be lost. Only an Architect will be able to succeed in the heroic action, but everyone will be able to perish in battle leading everything known to ruin. Good luck, that the glow of ETEREA accompany you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Merchants of Infinity
Description:
Welcome to the boundaries of space. Where worlds meet and collide.  Where mysteries abound and fortunes are there to be made – destinies to be forged, aboard the Mandelbrot space station. Do you have what it takes to beat the technobazaar, get the best deals, fulfill ship orders, trade, scheme and outwit all the other Merchants of Infinity?

Merchants of Infinity is a space-bound game of resource-management, worker-placement, hand-management, set-collecting, auctioning and making lots and lots of money!  Will you have the cunning and skill to master the markets, buy, trade and profit from the wildest dreams of spacers far and wide?  You will need to use strategy, guile, quick-thinking and planning ahead to amass a fortune and win the game!

M.O.I takes place on Mandelbrot:  a space station on the more-pleasant reaches of fractal space.  Traders, adventurers, travelers and tourists explore its crowded streets, sample its strange foods and trade and negotiate their way to profit and prosperity. Gameplay is in several phases:  First player is determined by a separate card-slinging round; second, the real trading begins then lastly, scores are resolved and we begin again! Whoever makes the most profit and gains the most Platinum (Victory Points) in a set number of rounds wins the game.

Players are influential merchants with wide-ranging influence and money to invest, to maximize profit.  Should they trade in technology or navigational charts this cycle or put their money into spices, jewelry and food?  Will they win their desired resources at a bargain price at the auction or secure a valuable order for goods at the spaceport?  The clock turns, the warp winds and fractal space unfolds..!

—description from the designer

Name: Atol
Description: In Atol, players are marine biologists cataloging species in a newly discovered Atoll. During the game, players flip a card with two sea animals and write one them down on their sheet trying to complete objectives. At the end of the game, the player who best catalogs the Atoll after 28 rounds is the winner!

Name: Goatskin: Rules for Football in the Ancient World
Description:
Want a fast pace game?
Want a chance to have come serious contact with an opponent?
Then Goatskin is the answer.

Goatskin is:
Football from the ancient world.
Football were there are few rules.
Football where every team can win.
Football where players can be put out of the game.

Goatskin is a two hour, fun filled game of small team football.

The game is a cross between rugby and hockey.
This game could never be played in real life.

So grab those old Roman legionaries and see if they can beat the druids!
Designed to be used with any figures. So pull up a flat surface and get your dice.

–description from publisher

Name: Party, Party!
Description:
Party, Party! is a game of risk and excitement. Because of his birthday, Mickey decides to have a super party! Your goal is to invite as many friends as possible.

Shuffle all the tiles (numbered 1 to 5) and lay them in a circle.

On your turn you throw the die and move Mickey Mouse that many steps. If the value of the tile is higher than the die, your turn ends. If the value is equal to or lower than the die, you have two options:

     Claim the tile and end your turn, or
     Cover the tile with the Mickey Mouse disc and throw the die again. You move Mickey again and if the second tile equals your die or is lower, you win both tiles. Otherwise your turn is over and you receive no tiles.


Mickey moves from tile to tile (clockwise) until there's only 1 tile left. Then, you simply throw the die for that last tile. Once the last tile is claimed, the game is over. The player with the highest total value of claimed tiles wins the game.

Name: Age of Valor: Thunder in the East, Russia at War 1877 and 1904
Description:
Thunder in the East, Russia at War 1877 and 1904 is an independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion chapter or mini-module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. It covers both the Russo-Turkish War of 1877 and the later Russo-Japanese War. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rule changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Any changes unique to the Russo-Turkish and Russo-Japanese Wars, the subject of this expansion set, are included for both the conflict overall, and the included battles of Plevna, Aladja Dagh for the Russo-Turkish War, Telissu and Liao Yang scenarios for the Russo-Japanese War.

The AOV product line is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 44 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at http://tinyurl.com/AOV-Research-Portal-1877-RTW for the Russo-Turkish War and http://tinyurl.com/AOV-Research-Portal-1904-RJW for the Russo-Japanese War.

—description from the designer

Name: WWE Cage Battle
Description:
WWE Cage Battle is dice-flicking family fun featuring awesome WWE Superstars!

Welcome to the cage! When the steel cage descends onto the ring, you know that the match you're about to witness will be intense, exciting, and unforgettable. Now it's your turn to pick who will go toe to toe in the WWE's most infamous setting. WWE Cage Battle is a dice-flicking dexterity game. Players make a team out of custom dice representing their favorite superstars, then take turns flicking them at their opponent's superstars, trying to beat them into submission, or knock them out of the ring! Stage a rematch like Roman Reigns vs. John Cena or Charlotte Flair vs. Sasha Banks, or try completely new combinations!

WWE Cage Battle includes two game modes; you can play to collect points, or keep going to be the last one standing!

—description from publisher

Name: Godzilla Rampage: Attack of the MUTO Supplement
Description:
Expansion 2 X Attack of the MUTO for Godzilla Rampage board game. Includes NEW and updated Kaiju cards and a NEW Scenario featuring the MUTOs.
Free print and play just like base game.

Name: Endangered: Tantrum House Promo Cards
Description: A group of 6 Promo cards that are different Ambassador cards than those in the base game : Melissa, Kevin, Sara, Ryan, Katie, Will.

Name: Blood Sweat & Iron: A Simple Set of American Civil War Ironclad River Combat Rules
Description:
Blood Sweat & Iron is a simple American Civil War Ironclad river actions rule set, it uses a very simple combat system to allow you to play battles within a couple of hours.

The system uses datasheets for each ship in the game, all are at the back of the rules ready for you to print out and use.

It is meant to be a fun game that offers the players a feel for the river battles of the era, this is not meant to be a true historical simulation.

There are no huge charts needed to play as almost everything you need is either on the ship’s datasheets or on a Quick Reference Sheet, all tokens are supplied as well.

The rules cover over eighty ships of the time, plus a few extras to add to your games like shore forts, barges and fire rafts etc. etc.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Quests
Description:
Welcome to Tamriel – a realm of adventure and wonder. Where danger lies around every corner and where fame and fortune await the bold. It is a realm you can enter today, if you have the courage to answer the Call to Arms! 

The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms is a tabletop wargame set against the epic, sprawling backdrop of Tamriel. From the teeming cities of Cyrodiil to the towering mountains of Skyrim, across the ash-plains of Morrowind, and through the steaming swamps of Black Marsh, you must lead your Party of bold warriors on the path to glory. In this game, you must select a mighty champion to lead your Party, surrounding them with heroes and staunch followers. Players can take on quests, unearth magical artifacts, and fight roaming monsters as they do battle against their opponent, using a combination of strength, stealth and magic to win the day. Call to Arms is a simple game to learn, but a challenge to master; your Party can be assembled in an almost endless variety of ways, each unlocking new tactics and abilities with which to test your skill as a commander and challenge your enemies.

Whether exploring trap-filled dungeons, or battling in some windswept wilderness, Tamriel is yours to explore – or exploit – as you see fit, building your forces to take on all comers. This rich setting gives players the opportunity for a vast array of different game types and play styles, as well as collecting and modeling highly detailed, characterful miniatures from The Elder Scrolls universe.

This Quest Book is the gateway to starting your adventure in Tamriel! 
It contains additional rules to those found in the Rulebook. Here you will learn about the different Game Modes, where you can battle with your friends or take on the wilds of Tamriel alone. 
Most importantly, you will find numerous ready-to-play scenarios, providing tactical challenges and narrative adventure for your games!
Families: Video Game Theme: The Elder Scrolls

Name: Charmed and Dangerous: Fairest in the Land
Description:
She is vain. She is wicked. And with thirteen words, she changed the land of myth and fable for all time. The Evil Queen failed to kill her hated stepdaughter once and Snow White is more beloved than ever, but the Queen's hatred has not softened over time. She has amassed a new army and new plans dedicated to destroying Snow White and her new allies. You and the other Princesses will have to band together to brave the traps and minions of the Jade Fortress and bring an end to the terrible reign of this legendary Villainess. The Fairest in the Land expansion for Charmed and Dangerous also adds 2 additional Villainesses to the game, a bonus lair, new Princesses and a brand new keyword mechanic for the game.

—description from the publisher
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Baba Yaga
Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White

Name: Tides of War
Description:
The tides of war change with every battle, can you adapt and triumph?
Build your world, then conquer it in this superior strategy game. Through this ever-changing world you must fight for dominion over the land. Expand your empire and destroy your foes, but be wary, the tides of war are ever changing. Will you triumph, or be swept away?
Tides of War is a game of conquest and adventure. Each player commands their own faction, building their armies up the combat their opponents for domination and control of the world.
Create your world with over 40 tiles, battle with 36 unique combat cards, and choose your faction to expand your empire with over 100 unique pieces. With two distinct game types you can change the way you play, and because you build a new board with every game, no two games are ever the same.
Find out if you can stand against the Tides of War.

Name: Harry Potter: Chamber of Secrets Heir of Slytherin – Chapter Game
Description:
Use the game board to store and carry your pieces.

First player to attack the basilisk with the Sword of Gryffindor and the Basilisk's Fang Cards wins the game!

Rotate the basilisk every time you roll the dice. But look out! If you're caught in it Petrifying gaze when it stops, you lose your turn.

Chase your Sorting Hat around the board to collect powerful cards.

Name: Storm the Gate
Description:
Knights, archers, and berserkers head into battle with one shared goal: to infiltrate the enemy's castle.

Storm the Gate is a two-player dexterity game, with each player sitting at opposite ends of the game board.

The object of the game is to get rid of all tokens on your side of the board (your camp) by shooting them onto your opponent's side (opponent’s camp) through the gate in the center of the board. This is accomplished by pulling the tokens against the bungee in your camp and releasing.

Once a player no longer has any tokens in their camp, the game is over.

—description from the publisher

Name: Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare
Description:
In the times before The Divide, the inhabitants of The Veiled Forest existed harmoniously. The seasons came and went each year, and there was peace among all creatures that made these woodlands their home. One morning, at the very edge of the winter solstice's arrival, all of this changed.

Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare, the sequel to Antsy Labs' Storm the Gate, is a frantic tabletop dexterity game in which you must rapidly move your army of heroes into your opponent's battle camp.

Introducing more depth than its predecessor, Storm the Gate: Woodland Warfare offers players the choice between two factions and six heroes - each hero belonging to a class with its own unique abilities and token dimensions.

You win the game by clearing all tokens from your camp before your opponent can do the same.

—description from the publisher

Name: Santa Fe
Description:
In Santa Fe, the players — western heroes that they are — aim to take as many tricks as possible during the eleven rounds of the game, in addition to collecting as many points as possible.

Unlike most games, lower-valued cards are worth more as the deck contains fewer of them. The players can challenge each other, as well as the sheriff, to the Mexican standoff. After a duel, only one player is left standing, and this player takes several tricks at the same time. The player who fights a duel at the most appropriate time and collects the largest points — as well as the highest number of special bandit cards — will be the final one standing when the game ends.

—description of publisher

Name: The Battle of Crotona, 204 BC
Description:
SPQR Battle scenario in C3i #24 (2010)

The battle of Crotona: The End of the Second Punic War in Italy, 204 BC
Families: Series: Great Battles of History (GMT Games)

Name: The Armoury Bible Game: The Accuser's Lair
Description:
The Accuser's Lair is a Boss deck expansion for The Armoury Bible Game (TABG) that allows players to battle The Accuser who is a dragon that represents the Devil in a massive underground chamber!

Players are able to set a game difficulty by adjusting the requarments to activate Boss abilities that harm players.

There are 22 unique Boss cards that allow for plenty of verability within games.

This Boss Expansion Deck can be combined with The Archer & Prophet Expansion Box to accommodate a 5 player gaming experience.

—description from the publisher

Name: Archer & Prophet Roles: The Armoury Bible Game
Description:
This expansion features 2 new player roles, the Archer and Prophet allowing The Armoury Bible Game to become a 4 player game (excluding the Game Master).

Combining this expansion with The Armoury Bible Game would allow for a 5 player experience (Including the Game Master).

The Archer & Prophet expansion also includes a larger box to hold your old cards along side the new cards. Such cards include:


     Archer role and armour cards
     Prophet role and armour cards
     Attack, defence and utility cards to expand your current game for the Archer and Prophet
     More Boss cards to accommodate the Archer and Prophet
     Health Point cards for the Archer and Prophet
     Player turn cards - these cards explain what players must do each turn and what roles go first 
     20 Quest cards - these are tasks that players much achieve after they play The Armoury Bible Game. Game Masters can use them to encourage players to continue their Bible learning for in-game rewards.


—description from the designer

Name: Tugboats
Description:
TugBoats is a two player ‘Tug of War’ cardgame where players play boats and tug ropes! Players plan their turn and choose a boat to reveal simultaneously.

Choose wisely as the fastest boat gets first choice of buoy bonuses but the strongest team moves the ribbon one step closer to victory! Each boat has it’s own unique special ability to help turn the tides in your favor!

—description from the publisher
